questions.question: Find the missing number in the series; 1, 2, 3, 10 _.
In the Fibonacci sequence, what is the sum of the squares of the first 10 terms?
If 9 times the seventh term of an Arithmetic Progression is equal to 12 times its eleventh term, then the 23rd term of the AP will be?
In an arithmetic sequence, the sum of the first n terms is 2n^2+n.  What is the 10th term of the sequence?
Suppose that a particular ‘TIGER’ is written as ‘QDFHS’. Find out how ‘FISH’ will be written in the same code
Using a particular pattern, ‘ROAR’ is coded as ‘URDU’. Select the right option for how ‘URDU’ will be written based on the same code.
Choose the word which is different from the rest.
Find the missing letter in the series: A, D, G, J, __, P.
Find the missing letters in the series, GAH, IBJ, KCL, MDN, _.
A is the son of C; C and Q are sisters; Z is the mother of Q and P is the son of Z. Which of the following statements is true?
options: P is the maternal uncle of A
Q is the maternal grandfather of A

questions.question: Pointing to a girl Sandeep said, She is the daughter of the only sister of my father.How is sandeep related to the girl?

What is Geeta's rank in the class?

Statement I: There are 30 students in the class.
Statement II: There are 10 students who scored less than Geeta.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient, but statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient, but statement I alone is not sufficient
Both I and II are needed
Neither I nor II is sufficient

questions.question:
When is Rahul's birthday this year?

I. It is between March 8 and 10, March 8 being the Wednesday.
II. It is not on Friday.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient, but statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient, but statement I alone is not sufficient
Either I or II is sufficient
Both I and II are needed

questions.question:
What is the monthly salary of Raman?

I. Raman gets 20% more than Suresh while Suresh gets 10% less than Rahul.
II. Rahul's monthly salary is Rs. 15000.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient, but statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient, but statement I alone is not sufficient
Either Statement I or II is sufficient
Both I and II are needed
questions.correctAnswer: Both I and II are needed

questions.question:
What is the total weight of 10 boxes, each having the same weight?

I. One-fourth of the weight of a box is 5 kg.
II. The total weight of the three boxes is 20 kilograms more than the total weight of the two boxes.
options: Statement I alone is sufficient, but statement II alone is not sufficient
Statement II alone is sufficient, but statement I alone is not sufficient
Data in both the statements together are not sufficient
Both I and II are needed
